name: Lake Powell
description: Lake Powell is one of the largest man-made reservoirs in the U.S., known for its red rock canyons and houseboat adventures.

name: Bear Lake
description: Bear Lake is known for its turquoise-blue water and is often referred to as the 'Caribbean of the Rockies.'

name: Utah Lake
description: Utah Lake is a large shallow freshwater lake in Utah Valley with several recreational access points.

name: Deer Creek Reservoir
description: Deer Creek Reservoir offers cool mountain scenery and excellent water recreation just 45 minutes from Salt Lake City.

name: Jordanelle Reservoir
description: Jordanelle Reservoir is a popular destination offering scenic views, boating, and paddle sports near Park City.

name: Flaming Gorge Reservoir
description: Flaming Gorge offers dramatic red rock cliffs and deep water, making it ideal for boating and trophy fishing.

name: Mirror Lake
description: Mirror Lake sits at 10,400 ft in the Uintas and allows only non-motorized watercraft—ideal for peaceful paddleboarding.

name: Tibble Fork Reservoir
description: Tibble Fork is a family-friendly reservoir with no motorized boats allowed; it's popular for paddleboarding and has beach access.

name: Silver Lake Flat Reservoir
description: Silver Lake Flat is reachable via dirt road and provides a quieter nearby alternative for paddle sports.

name: Causey Reservoir
description: Causey Reservoir prohibits motor boats, making it ideal for quiet paddleboarding; it’s also popular for cliff jumping.

name: East Canyon Reservoir
description: East Canyon Reservoir is small and calm—perfect for beginners in paddleboarding, with non-motorized access.

name: Sand Hollow Reservoir
description: Sand Hollow offers warm water and red rock scenery—great for paddle sports and motorized boating.

name: Smith and Morehouse Reservoir
description: This no‑wake reservoir allows only non‑motorized boats, surrounded by forests and peaks.

name: Little Dell Reservoir
description: Little Dell offers a hand‑launch ramp for non‑motor crafts and is a popular picnic and paddle spot near SLC.

name: Blackridge Reservoir
description: A small neighborhood lake with motor‑free boating, sandy beaches, and playground facilities.

name: Starvation Reservoir
description: Starvation Reservoir (Fred Hayes State Park) is open year-round for boating, fishing, paddleboarding, and camping.

name: Quail Creek Reservoir
description: Quail Creek is popular near St. George for warm-water boating and paddle sports.

name: Hyrum Reservoir
description: Hyrum State Park’s reservoir is used for waterskiing, boating, paddleboarding, and fishing.

name: Pineview Reservoir
description: Pineview is a popular mountain reservoir with sandy beaches, boating, and paddle sports.

name: Rockport Reservoir
description: Rockport is well-known for calm water and family-friendly paddleboarding.

name: Lost Creek Reservoir
description: Lost Creek is a non-motor reservoir favored for its serenity and non-wake paddling.

name: Bountiful Pond
description: A small neighborhood pond great for kayaking and paddleboarding, sheltered and rarely busy.

name: Spanish Oaks Reservoir
description: A small peaceful reservoir good for paddle sports and fishing with well-maintained park amenities.
